summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing operational planning for a search warrant execution on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James in the Virgin Islands. It details travel logistics, personnel coordination, and the status of the investigation, including victim interviews and digital evidence processing.

persons.name: Lenny
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) in an internal FBI email forwarding a Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCN) update regarding Epstein.

events.title: FBI team deployment to Virgin Islands
events.description: Planned deployment of the main FBI search team to St. Thomas via FBI Q400 plane, arriving around 7pm.

events.title: Search warrant execution on Little St. James
events.description: Planned execution of a search warrant on Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little St. James, scheduled for 6am.

events.title: SCN update regarding island search
events.description: A Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCN) update was issued with information regarding the planned search of Epstein's island.

locations: Little St. James (Epstein's private island, Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The FBI was planning a major search operation on Jeffrey Epstein's 70+ acre private island, Little St. James, involving approximately 40 personnel.
As of August 7, 2019, all but one co-conspirator in the case had been served; the remaining one was a British citizen who was 'out of pocket'.
Victim and witness interviews were ongoing, and digital media seized from Epstein's residence was being processed for review.
The SDNY was working with lawyers on securing co-conspirator cooperation.
Logistical planning included coordination with Customs and Border Protection (CBP), the Coast Guard, and local authorities for transportation and the search operation.
